title: New Pool Drone Photo & Video Project
tagline: Cinematic storytelling that elevated brand perception.

hero.alt: Aerial drone shot of completed pool

context.problem: Marketing relied on inconsistent job-site photos taken by staff, lacking emotional impact and visual consistency. No aspirational visual narrative.
constraints: Active construction sites with safety concerns
FAA regulations for commercial drone use
context.quote: Show the craftsmanship. Show the experience. Show what's possible.

solution.approach: Developed comprehensive drone media initiative using DJI and custom FPV drones to capture cinematic aerial footage and photography, creating a reusable media library for all marketing channels.

gallery.caption: FPV Drone Flythrough - Caribbean Pools Project
gallery.alt: FPV drone video flythrough of pool installation

impact.label: Social Engagement
impact.description: 4x increase in social engagement across Instagram and Facebook.

impact.label: Brand Perception
impact.description: Positioned Caribbean Pools as a premium builder through cinematic storytelling.

impact.label: Conversion Rates
impact.description: Sales teams leveraged footage in consultations to close deals faster.

impact.label: Reusable Assets
impact.description: Built a searchable library of photos and video assets for ongoing marketing.

process.title: Capture & Workflow
process.description: Captured cinematic drone and FPV footage at project sites. Built repeatable workflow for scouting, flight planning, and editing.

process.title: Brand Integration
process.description: Applied branded overlays and LUT color grading to maintain visual consistency across all media.

process.title: Media Library
process.description: Created searchable media library for marketing and sales teams to access assets quickly.

process.title: Multi-Channel Distribution
process.description: Integrated content into web, social, and digital ads for maximum reach and engagement.

reflection.learning: Aspirational visuals don't just show a productâ€”they tell a story. Invest in emotion, not just documentation.
